column1: nice line and length in the channel outside off, lets it go

trapped in front but Roy reviews. That was a mighty close shout, pitched in line and nipped back in. Height may be an issue. and it is going over the stumps, so Roy survives. But he was playing all around that one, beaten by the movement inwards and groping with bat well away from ball
pacy inswinger at 88mph, almost yorker length on off, Roy is coming forward but gets an inside edge that rolls to fine leg
going across him from over the wicket and tailing into him. Roy goes to drive it, but inside edges onto pad
excellent line, hitting the hard length and nibbling at off, defended from the crease. Nips into him a tad again
length going a mite across him, stays beside it and pushes to point
drops short of midwicket Back of a length outside off, he goes to pull, gets a top edge that dinks down just out of reach of the fielder
good length on the stumps, patted back
Good length on off, defended from the crease
Back of a length wide of off, flays at it with feet rooted, no connection
short outside off, Bairstow looks to free his arms with the pull but can't lay bat on it
length outside off, nudged into the covers but straight to the fielder to complete a maiden over
length ball pushed across him, pushed sweetly but straight to wide-ish mid-on... and straight through him! Races away for four. Sloppy stuff from Cummins, and Starc looks to the sky in frustration
length ball at 88mph/142kph outside the off stump. Roy has a flash but can't lay bat on it
good length, angling across the right-hander with a bit of width at 90mph/145kph. Roy throws the bat again, but again can't make contact
short ball at the left shoulder, 90mph/146kph, but too straight and too high
slightly full of a length, Roy skips outside leg stump to give himself room to hit over the off-side ring, but misses it completely
short ball in at the biceps, down the leg side, but not called wide this time as Roy ducks
slightly full of a length on sixth stump, Roy shuffles across to the off side and plays tip-and-run to mid-on, just about making his ground as Cummins throws slightly wide of the stumps
banged in on a length at 85mph/137kph, Roy is beaten for pace and struck on the back thigh. Bit of seam movement into the batsman
uses his feet to skip down and give himself room to flay through wide mid-off for four! No timing, right off the toe, but enough power to get through the ring
hard length on off stump, chokes the bat with the bottom hand to work to short midwicket
length on sixth stump, nudged to short extra cover
just a fraction overpitched for once, and Roy clips off the pads through square leg for four
shorter this time but too wide, and Roy flays through point for four more! He's up and running now, square-cutting to get it in between backward point and cover in the circle

edged, gone! 90mph/145kph, pushed across the right-hander, and Bairstow nicks off. Starc had been hooping the ball into the batsmen but this one held its line and took the edge of Bairstow's apologetic prod. Australia get their breakthrough
back of a length outside off, Root drops the hands and sways inside the line
slightly full of a length on fourth stump, driven to mid-off
banged in on a length, Root opens the face to guide it into the covers
nibbles in from back of a length, and Root looks to flick into the leg side. It strikes him on the backside, and runs away fine for four leg byes

inside-edged into the body, and Root hits the deck! Length ball pushed across him as he looked to drive through the covers, but he only managed to inside-edge into the back knee and will get some treatment from the physio
bit of nibble away, but Root steers behind square on the leg side as he comes across
shimmies down to flick into the leg side and scamper through for a single to wide mid-on. Doesn't look like that injury is causing him too much trouble, then
length outside off, Roy swivel-pulls into the leg side but hits the sweeper
full and straight, nudged in front of square on the leg side via the inside half of the bat
short outside off, Roy uses his feet to come down but can only swat to the cover-point fielder
length in the channel, dabbed into the ground on the crease
sprayed very wide of the off stump. Left alone, and called wide
beauty! Straight past the outside edge as Root is half-forward, half-back while defending. Starc angles this across him, and a hint of nibble away takes it past the bat
wild waft outside the off stump at a 90mph/146kph half-volley, and no connection
banged in on a length, steered to point on the bounce with an open face
hint of movement in off the seam as Root drives a full ball to mid-off. 91mph/146kph - good pace throughout this first spell from Starc
length in the channel, Root attempts his trademark guide down to third man but is cramped for room, and can't get bat on it. Looks out of nick!

length on off stump, nudged into the covers for a sharp single and a direct hit means he's gone! Roy was running to the danger end and was miles short of his ground. Brilliant stuff from Stoinis, who picks up and throws in one smooth movement, and sets off in celebration after knocking down the stumps. Australia are buzzing!
length outside off, bit of width but it dies off the surface and flies under Root's bat
nips in off the seam to hit Root on the thigh pad. No appeal, going over the top and possibly down leg too
beauty! Nips away off the seam to beat Root's defensive push as he comes down the pitch. Wry smiles from both bowler and batsman
length on the hip, clipped into the leg side and Stoinis at short midwicket dives to his right at full stretch to cut it off
width outside off, Root frees his arms to cut and connects well, but can't beat Maxwell at backward point on the bounce
length on off stump, Root defends to short cover to complete a second maiden for Hazlewood
length ball on fifth stump, beats Morgan's dangled bat. No real foot movement
length on the pads, whipped down to long leg
outswinger on a length, left alone
banged in, back of a length at 88mph/142kph, and steered into the off side
bit of width outside off, Root swings and misses again! Shaped for a wristy cut but lost his shape and was late on the shot
back of a length, more width outside off, and Root bottom-edges the cut through to Carey on the bounce
back of a length, clipped off the hip through backward square leg. Root set off for two but was sent back by a 'no, no, no!' from his captain
slightly full of a length on fourth stump, nudged to short cover
length outside off, steered behind square on the off side to finally get off 2!
back of a length, nudged towards mid-off with a straight bat
fuller on leg stump, clipped to mid-on by Morgan
length ball outside off, Morgan has a flirt but can't lay bat on it
length on off stump, nudged to short midwicket
very full on off stump at 88mph/142kph, Root digs it out, straight to short midwicket on the bounce
nips in from a length, clipped to square leg
or maybe it was! Length ball on fourth stump, Root heaves across the line and gets it just past backward square leg in the ring
beautiful shot! Bit of a half-volley from Cummins, too much width and Root brings out an exquisite cover drive. It flies off the middle of that new bat and away for four!
length on off stump, Root rocks onto the back foot and clips through square leg to keep the strike
length in the channel, nudged to Maxwell at point
length outside off, checked drive out to mid-off
length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
length on fourth stump, Root defends to short cover on the bounce
slightly overpitched on fourth stump, Root drives down the ground with a straight bat but can't beat mid-on
length on fifth stump, steered down to third man to keep the strike
length on fifth stump at 88mph/141kph, nudged to short cover
length on sixth stump, Root gets across to work towards midwicket
beaten! Root's bat has lost its magical powers. Immaculate line and length from Cummins, Root is cramped for room while shaping to drive and it flies past the shoulder of the bat
length on fourth stump, stabbed to backward point with an open face
back of a length outside off, steered to backward point where Maxwell leaps like a salmon to his left and keeps the pressure building
slightly fuller on fourth stump, Root's hand comes off the bat as he shapes to drive and it dribbles towards cover
pushed across him, Morgan times this sweetly in front of square but can't get it past cover point, Sams on as a sub, in the ring
Marsh is tight to the stumps, and Morgan is cramped for room shaping to cut

back of a length ball, doesn't really get up off the surface and Marsh belts out an appeal as it hits Morgan on the pad! Finch isn't interested, though. Slower ball, and looked like it was going over the top
length ball nudged towards mid-on, tidy start from Marsh
pushed across Morgan, who tries to cut but is cramped for room, and bottom-edges through to Carey on the bounce
nagging line on off stump, Morgan defends from a length and that's another maiden
length outside off, jags back in and he bunts it towards mid-on
ooh, swing and a miss. Not full enough to drive and on the fifth stump, Root aimed an ambitious drive on the up but didn't connect
bangs this in short outside off but Root rides the bounce nicely to steer it to third man from his chest
length ball on leg, going across him, defended back down the pitch
bouncer, but banged down too short over leg stump and that'll be a wide for height
follows it up with a better bouncer, over leg stump again but this one forces Morgan to duck under it
keeps up the short ball attack, this one into the rib cage and Morgan defends it back from the crease
fuller on off, almost falls over while going across and clipping towards mid-on

back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot and there's a misfield at point which means it goes through and finds the boundary. Marnus there I think, who was moving to his left and tumbled to stop it but made a hash of it
back of a length on off, whipped off the back foot but can't go past midwicket
length ball, straighter, flicked to midwicket's right for a single

another misfield, by short midwicket this time. Shimmies down the track and flicks it off his pads. The fielder lets it go through, though admittedly he didn't have a whole lot of time to react. Still should have stopped it. They get a couple
uppish but in the gap through backward point. Full outside off, he opens the face to drive
length on the stumps, trying to deny him room. Morgan cuts from close to his body but point stops it to his right
fuller on the stumps, tries to stroke it through cover, but not timed
short ball, Morgan decides to attack but gets an under-edge on the pull that rolls down to fine leg
half an appeal as this one is dug in short and sliding down leg. He moves inside the line to pull, but doesn't connect.
jags back in sharply from outside off and Root wears a blow on the abdomen trying to pull this
fuller on the pads, turned to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, doesn't bounce much, Root stays beside it and punches to point
still not finding the gaps is Root. Back of a length on off, goes on the back foot to punch, straight to cover
half a step down and flicks it, beats midwicket but can't beat mid-on who was moving to his right to cut it off. Still no single for Root

and that is what happens when you're struggling for runs. Gets one a bit short and pulls fiercely. Not perfectly timed but would have got runs if he had placed it better. But short midwicket dives to his left and saves
finally gets one away. Length outside off, gets down low and late cuts to third man
slower ball back of a length to start off, on leg stump. Root was moving to pull but too early into the shot and ends up missing it
fuller outside off, flicked to mid-on by walking across and gets a single
good length nipping across gently, defended solidly from the crease

just out of reach of Cummins at deep square leg. Not sure Stoinis intended to bowl a short ball on leg stump given his field, but Morgan moves across and swivels to pull hard. Cummins at deep square leg dives to his left, would have been a spectacular catch if he had got to it. But it eludes him
length on the stumps, nudged to midwicket
back of a length outside off, Morgan stays low and cuts it late to third man's left. They sprint back for the second
fuller sliding down leg, misses the flick but it takes the pad to backward square leg and they get a single
down the track but this was dug into the pitch on a line just outside off, and Morgan can't get to the pitch, ends up bunting it with a flat bat to cover
strays down leg a bit with this back of length one and he'll have to re-bowl that
sticking in the pitch a bit, on a length on the stumps, Morgan backing away but can't create enough room, ends up jabbing it close to his body to mid-off
some shape in the air and misfield by Warner at cover allows a single. Strange one. Full ball driven, but not timed, and Warner just seemed to lose it while bending down to collect
down the track again, gets a bit of an inside edge to deep square leg trying to swing through the line
clipped to midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, swivels pulls it, gets a bit of an under-edge to fine leg
back of a length on the fourth stump, he moves across and pulls to deep square leg. Ball didn't really bounce much
nicely done, length ball going across him, waits and late cuts it to third man. There is a fielder there so only one run
good shot and that will give Root a bit of a breather. Back of a length on off, stays still and punches through cover with beautiful timing. Finds the boundary
length ball nipping in, jabbed towards backward point
bang goes Root! Dances down the track and disdainfully pulls a short ball. Nice thwacking sound off the bat as it flies hard and straight over midwicket.
length ball, cramping him for room, tries to cut from close to his body. Ball doesn't travel much towards short third man, no single
down the track and goes over the in-field. Bat turned in his hand and not timed that at all but it lands safely over extra cover. Not enough legs on it to go to the boundary though
length on the stumps, goes back and across to flick, but can't beat midwicket
too full, tailing onto leg stump, flicked to fine leg off the toe-end of the bat
length ball down leg, flicked off his hips to deep backward square leg
length on off, dabbed towards point. No single as the fielder comes swooping in
tossed up on the stumps, goes right back and gently turns it into the legside
tossed up, a bit too full, allows Root to sweep to deep square leg

caught at slip. The move works, both to bring in Zampa and to have a slip for the right-hander. Nicely tossed up, Root's taking a step forward, but the ball dips before he can get to the pitch and turns just enough to take the outside edge. Smart take from Finch, to his right.
tossed up, full on the stumps, driven to a very straight mid-on
some drift into him but a bit too full, shovelled to fine leg
length ball on the stumps, stays still and carefully pats it down towards short leg
back of a length on off, turned backward of square
fuller outside off, driven but off the toe-end and cover fields
dug in short but doesn't bounce much, Morgan pulls to deep square leg.
half a step down the track and flicks this length ball from his pads to fine leg
gorgeous. Full outside off, comes on the front foot and uses his wrists to power a drive over cover and into the boundary
length on off, pushes it gently but wide of the fielder at cover and towards long-off for a single
fuller on off, driven to mid-off
reverse swept fine and he'll get a boundary. Great execution. Tossed up on off and he committed to the shot early, and got the placement right
oh nicely done. Morgan's shifted gears from 2 to 5 in the blink of an eye almost. Not that tossed up, but he gets to the pitch with a stride and uses wrists to drive over the in-field
flatter and quicker, nudged to short third man
length on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
slightly quicker, played into the offside on the back foot
length in the channel, moving away, pushes at it but beaten
fuller on off, clipped to midwicket

trapped in front but Buttler reviews immediately. Inside edge? After moving the last one away, Cummins brought this one back in. Buttler was pushing at it and it beats his bat. No inside edge. Hits in line and umpire's call on hitting the stumps! Buttler will have to go, what a great bowling change once again from Finch.
length ball coming into him, defended towards mid-on
length on off, angling into him from a bit wider of the crease, steered to backward point
yorker on off stump, dug out to mid-on. No single. wicket maiden
length outside off, opens the face to guide to point
nice drift, on a length, pushes him back and he tentatively jabs it down
tossed up outside off, fuller, slaps a drive to extra cover
tossed up outside off, clipped back to the bowler on the front foot
tossed up on leg stump, turned to short fine leg's right
tossed up full on the stumps, whips a drive, but to mid-on
length ball coming into him, punched back

stunning from Morgan. Seemed like an off-balance push but it goes straight past the bowler and into the boundary. He was making room, Cummins bowled it full, Morgan seemed to gently punch it back, off the toe end of the bat. Timed well enough to go all the way
short outside off, pulls with authority but Marnus is at deep square leg and fields
beaten. Length ball outside off, Billings is getting down low to steer it but it bounces over his bat
banged in short, rises up to the helmet but Billings takes it on, swivels back and pulls to deep square leg
length on the stumps, punched to midwicket
gets some drift, fuller on le gstump, turned to short fine leg

down the track and pushes to mid-on. Wants a single but is wisely sent back. Mid-on and mid-off are both in the circle. and almost carelessly run out was Billings but he's back in the crease. The throw came in and Carey whipped off the bails. Billings was ambling back with bat stuck outside the crease but stepped inside with boot in time
pushed to mid-on
fuller and swept hard, deep square leg cleans up

huge shout not given and Finch reviews. Great loop on this, pitches on a length on middle and turns past his forward defensive to hit him on the knee roll. and it's three reds so that's a fabulous review and an extremely critical wicket. Excellent bowling. Drew him forward, got the ball to dip and turn enough to beat bat but not enough to be missing the stumps
fullish on off, comes forward and jams his bat in defence
length on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
fuller on the stumps, full face of the bat in defence, bounces over the leaping bowler
kept low, but Billings did well to get his bat down in time and defend into the offside. Length outside off and jagging back into him
tight line and length nibbling around off stump steered to point
length on the fourth stump again, guided to backward point.
fuller on the stumps, punched nicely but straight to mid-on. Another maiden
googly, stretches well forward to defend towards mid-on
length ball on off, pushed with the turn to cover
huge shout but not given again. Inside edge on that. No review. Googly, quicker one that he didn't pick, and was caught on the crease.
tossed up on the stumps, driven to short cover

length ball on the stumps pushed gently and Zampa a bit sloppy there, could have got a maiden for himself and two in a row for Australia by moving to his left and fielding but slips up. They get a single
full, tailing into him, driven to mid-off
beaten. Backing away, but this is on off, on back of a length and moving in a touch. He can't get bat on it
fuller on the pads, flicked away but short midwicket dives to his left to field
flayed through cover and that will break the shackles a bit. Fuller on off, comes on the front foot and slams it
another one keeps low. Length around off and nipping in, Billings gets his bat down in time to keep the ball out
length ball nipping in, goes to drive, gets it off the inside half of the bat to mid-on.
tossed up on off, driven inside out past extra cover
sharply spinning googly, pitches well outside off and cuts back in. He didn't read it but had enough time to jab it away
fuller, clipped to mid-on
full toss, and he doesn't let the gift go. Flat bats it straight past the bowler, good timing and gets the boundary
length on off, steered to point
tossed up full on the stumps, driven to mid-off
moves well across his stumps to a full ball outside off but can only defend it into the offside
keeping a tight line outside off, defended towards gully
back of a length and nipping in, Billings goes to pull but is struck on the thigh pad
length ball on off, walks across and works it through square
fuller on off, goes to drive, gets it off the inside half of the bat as it trickles to mid-on
good connection with the pull shot. Short ball outside off and he hits it sweetly but there is a sweeper who'll clean up
tossed up on leg stump, but that is a super shot by Woakes. Too full and flicks it with the spin - was the googly - and places it between mid-on and midwicket
good length on the stumps, comes on the front foot to defend
tossed up on off, driven to long-off
flatter on middle and leg, swept to deep square leg
quicker and a bit shorter, on leg and turning across, whipped to midwicket
tossed up, dips and spins past his bat as he's coming on the front foot to push
full one angling into him, driven to extra cover
length ball into him on the stumps, steered to point's right from close to his body, with bat close to pad
length outside off, comes on the front foot and reaches to drive. Fielded by cover
full into his pads, flicked uppishly but clears midwicket
fuller outside off, driven to deep cover
full on the stumps, driven to mid-on

chopped on! Billings gave himself room to cut but this was too straight and cramped him for room. A flat legbreak, just a hint of turn and it zipped through, taking the bottom edge and diverted onto the stumps. Slightly fuller than Billings anticipated
googly, fenced to point where Starc misfields, and Curran gets off the mark straightaway
tossed up on off stump, Woakes presses out to long-off
nudged into the covers defensively
googly again, blocked out to cover
legbreak, shovelled into the leg side off the hip
length outside off, inside-edged towards mid-on
wide on the crease, Woakes digs out a full ball, nudging towards cover
fullish on fifth stump, driven into the covers but Warner gets down brilliantly from in tight to stop it getting through the ring
banged in on a length at 89mph/144kph, Woakes looks to work to leg but only manages to squirt into the covers via a leading edge
low full toss, driven out to deep cover. Attempted yorker, slightly overpitched

nicks him off! Or does he? Gough, standing in his first game since the third Test vs Pakistan, isn't sure if it carried through to Carey. Starc ran his fingers down the side of this, hitting a length on fifth stump, and drew an outside edge as Curran looked to steer towards third man. The catch is a tight call, but it looks like it's going to be given, as Carey had just about got his gloves under the ball. Curran trudges off, Australia have seven!
bit of late movement back in as Woakes inside-edges into the back pad. Strangled appeal, but definitely bat first
length ball angling in towards the top of off at 88mph/141kph, defended towards mid-on
length on sixth stump, steered to backward point
searing yorker at 87mph/141kph, dug out into the leg side
back of a length, Curran defends while jumping onto the back foot
length on fifth stump, pressed out to mid-off
wide on the crease, Woakes gives himself some room but only defends into the covers
half-volley, wide outside off, and Woakes frees his arms, lofting over short cover and flaying this away for four! Room to extend the arms, and gets it comfortably over the man in tight
length ball, tucked off the hip out to square leg
full on leg stump, Curran misses out as he nudges defensively towards mid-on. Hint of late tail on that - ball seems to be reversing
attempted slower ball, turns into a low full toss on fifth stump but Curran only pats back down the pitch
yorker at 86mph/139kph, dug out back down the pitch

length ball in the channel, and Woakes is the latest man to nick off! Classic Hazlewood, banged in on a length on fourth or fifth stump, and there's just a fraction of movement away off the seam. That's enough to take the edge as Woakes shapes to punch through the covers, and Carey gobbles up an easy chance. England reeling at 149 for 8!
length ball, tucked round the corner to long leg
good length again, Curran looks to work into the leg side but is struck on the thigh pad and it dribbles down towards his feet
nails that hard length on fourth stump again, Curran can only defend into the covers
Curran uses his feet, so Hazlewood drags his length ball. Curran can only steer defensively out towards backward point
immaculate line and length in the off-stump channel, and Curran stays on nought, defending towards cover
drag-down, and Rashid heaves a pull out to square leg
fullish on fifth stump, nudged to mid-on
googly, tossed up on off stump. Slashed out to deep cover by Curran to finally get off the mark
legbreak on a length, Rashid defends down the pitch
legbreak down the leg side, Rashid looks to prod into the leg side but it strikes his pad and dribbles onto the next strip
prodded defensively towards mid-off
Curran uses his feet, but can't beat short cover as he gives himself room
uses his feet again, freeing his arms to a straight length ball and hacking it over midwicket for four! Heaved over the ring, and races away after a couple of bounces
too much width outside off, and cut hard out towards point. Stoinis gets round brilliantly from deep cover, diving to his left to cut off the boundary
banged in on a length, Curran clips into the leg side hoping for two but it's never there, and they decide against the second
tight to the stumps, and a tight off-stump line. Rashid tickles it round the corner for a single towards fine leg
beaten! Curran is foxed by a slower ball, which droops past his outside edge as he prods forward
full on leg stump, jammed out to wide long-on
lebgreak, down the leg side, and tucked round the corner to short fine leg
tossed up outside off, and slashed hard to long-off where Warner fields
tossed up outside off, smacked down to long-on for a jogged single
uses his feet to tickle out to straight midwicket. They run the first one hard hoping for a second, but it's never there
full legbreak, Rashid lunges forward to defend
banged in on a length, Curran clips behind square for a single on the leg side
slightly full of a length on the stumps, Rashid flicks down to fine leg
length on fourth stump, and Curran frees his arms, bludgeoning this straight back down the ground for four! One bounce, cleared his front leg and mowed it back over Cummins' head
length ball, edged very fine but Zampa gets round to cut off the boundary
short ball, loops way over Rashid's head as he ducks, and called wide
length ball, angling in, and it strikes Rashid on the pad. Enthusiastic appeal from Cummins, but it looked way too high, and might have struck him outside the line. Finch chooses not to review
hangs a length ball wide of the off stump, Rashid flirts at it and misses
length ball, Curran looks to go down the ground and crunches it back over Starc's head for four more! Stood pretty still, cleared the front leg, and heaved it for four
slower ball bouncer, which takes Curran by surprise, and he lets it loop through to the keeper
attempted yorker, turns into a low full toss which Curran shapes to thump into next week, but he doesn't connect
full outside off, and late tail away from the bat takes it past Curran's swing
fullish on fourth stump, driven out into the off side for a single
spears in a yorker at the base of the stumps, which Rashid clips out towards midwicket to retain the strike
fullish outside off, whipped wristily round the corner for one towards long leg
slower ball, wide outside off. Curran clears the front leg and slashed cross-batted, getting a thick edge out towards third man, who fields on the bounce
length on fourth stump, Rashid decides now is the time to accelerate and he heaves a one-bounce four over mid-on! The man was in the ring, and he rightly backed himself to clear himself
short ball, which takes Rashid by surprise. He looks to swat it into the leg side, but can't get bat on it
cutter, wide outside off, and carved out towards point. Stoinis' throw from the boundary hits the stumps, and they take a second on the ricochet
short ball, which Rashid ducks underneath, and Saggers says it's too far down the leg side, much to Cummins' chagrin
short again at the left shoulder. Rashid swats at it unconvincingly and misses, but it's slightly straighter this time
attempted yorker, which turns into a low full toss. Curran digs it out with an angled bat, opening the face and running it away through third man. Hint of edge, and it runs away fine for four!
length on the stumps, squirted down to third man with an open face
fullish and straight, Rashid gives himself room to free the arms and heaves towards wide mid-on for a single
slower ball on a length, but down the leg side
full on fourth stump, carved out to Warner on the edge of the ring at wide mid-off
slower ball, Rashid shuffles across so Starc hangs it wider of the off stump, and Rashid adjusts accordingly, running it down to wide third man despite being cramped for room
full on fourth stump, pushed out into the covers and they take one to the man on the edge of the ring
full outside off, Rashid frees the arms and lofts over backward point for four to bring up the 50 partnership! Cleared the front leg, opened the face, and chipped it behind square
Rashid swats awkwardly at a short ball, which beats him and flies through to Carey

banged in, back of a length, and Rashid swats at it, sending it over the rope for six! Didn't quite get up as he'd have liked, and Rashid cleared the front leg, hooking towards the shorter boundary. The wind carried it over Labuschagne on the rope, and it's half a dozen more!
length outside off, Rashid slugs in front of square and picks up four more! Looked like a slower ball, and Rashid shifted his weight forward, heaving through midwicket

full and wide outside off, Rashid gets it away behind square on the off side and Stoinis just about prevents the boundary. They race back for the third, and this is turning into a very expensive over!
slower ball on a length, punched out to the man sweeping on the cover boundary
slower ball on a length, Curran pulls hard in front of square on the leg side, finding the gap between midwicket and deep backward square to pick up four!
slower ball bouncer at the left shoulder, Curran swings at it but can't get bat on it. Gough has a long think, and belatedly calls wide
length outside off, pulled out towards wide long-on for a scurried two
hard length, banged in, and Curran top-edges the pull towards mid-on. Finch races in off the fence and throws at the bowler's end, but Rashid just about gets in
cleaned up this time! A vital 76-run partnership finally comes to an end. Pace on this time, slightly full of a length, and it crashes into middle and leg as Curran looks to heave over the leg side
length on fifth stump, slashed out to wide long-off and they race back for two

slower ball into the pitch, Archer swings cross-batted and sends it back over Marsh's head for four! He set himself early, anticipating the short ball, and picked the slower ball early, bludgeoning it dead-straight down the ground
full on middle and leg, clipped to square leg. Sloppy work from England first up, allowing the single, with Tom Curran failing to collect the ball cleanly
length on the stumps, moving a touch away, Finch hops into the tuck past short midwicket, but can't go past mid-on

full on the stumps, driven back firmly and he sets off for the single. Woakes got his hand to it and half-stopped it. Mid-off swoops in and lets fly a throw. Finch wasn't even in the frame but the ball doesn't hit the stumps. Morgan the fielder
back of a length moving across him, stays on the back foot and defends to short cover
back of a length, he rocks back to pull. Not short enough, gets an under-edge that square leg is onto quickly
full on the stumps, looked like Warner might have been hanging on the back foot a bit, but he gets bat in front to steer to third man's left
ooh he has a bit of a waft at it but then pulls his bat away. Back of a length and going across him from Archer
short and wide, Warner goes after it but only gets a toe-end to the cut. Carries over point but not enough legs to go to the boundary
bluffs with a full straight one on middle. Finch stays beside it and drives to cover
length ball in the channel, pushed to point
length ball in the channel again, tries to punch off the back-foot, mis-times to point
superb yorker to finish, Finch just about gets his bat down in time in front of middle stump to squirt it away towards mid-off
length ball, stump to stump, blocked towards mid-off
length on off, pushes on the back foot to mid-off. Ball goes off the end of the bat
too straight that time, and Warner tucks through midwicket off his pads
sharp in-cutter that catches Finch on the crease. Loud appeal but probably going down. Inside edge too. Finch was rooted to his crease and trying to punch
down the track, takes it on the half-volley and drives firmly straight past the bowler. Archer at mid-on moves to his left and tumbles to stop it. Good work
fuller outside off, driven - but can't beat the in-field
pacy ball on a length on off stump, Finch defends towards mid-off on the back foot
good bouncer, at 88 mph. Finch decides to go after it but he's beaten for pace. Too late on the pull and can't connect as the ball flies past
strays on the pads and Finch tickles it fine. There's a man back there

got him again! Archer has the wood on Warner. This was a scorcher at 91 mph, back of a length and moves across, has Warner poking at it in the channel. Awkward height too, with the ball near rib-cage. Takes a thin edge through to Buttler.
back of a length outside off, pushed tentatively to point
back of a length, dug into the pitch but down leg, he clips it off his hips to square leg
full outside off, pushed to extra cover on the front foot
fuller on the pads, clipped but can't beat short midwicket

stunning. Where did that come from?! Down the track and Stoinis drives with a very straight bat, lofts it all the way over the bowler and the boundary line. What a hit. That's a shot that deserves a roaring audience.
fuller on off, driven to mid-off
back of a length coming into him, defended back to the bowler
length ball coming into him, blocked back
length ball on the stumps, tapped towards short midwicket. Thinks about a single, but decides against it. Wisely
gets on top of this and beats a diving point fielder to get a boundary. Width offered outside off, and room too with it being back of length. Finch gets on top of it and cuts nicely
fuller and straight on middle, goes back and across to clip from in front of his pads to midwicket

Finch gets pinged on the helmet. That is one heck of a quick bouncer at 91 mph and on target. Finch moving across to pull but that's too quick for him. Bangs into the top of the helmet and they'll actually get four leg-byes for it. Finch seems fine but the docs will check on him as per protocol. The helmet took the brunt of the impact.
another shot ball that has Finch hopping. This one isn't dug in as short, and it's outside off, Finch jabs at it with bat away from body and pushes to cover
length ball strays down leg, flicks the thigh pad on the way to fine leg. Finch couldn't connect with his attempted glance but they'll get a leg-bye anyway
boom. Finch may have been hopping against Archer but if he gets a full and wide one outside off he's not going to hang back. Lashes this through cover with a strong bottom hand
down the track but Woakes shortens his length a tad, and Finch pushes past the bowler. Archer at mid-on in the action again, fields the ball
back of a length outside off, defended solidly
fuller and into him, stands tall and on-drives. Mid-on fields
length on off, stays back and punches, but can't get past cover
fuller, comes on the front foot to drive, gets it off the inside half of the bat to Archer at mid-on, who lets fly a rocket throw. Not at the stumps, beats the keeper too, but no overthrows.
back of a length but on leg, rises up on his toes to clip this off the thigh pad to square leg
outside edge falls just short of backward point. Finch had no clue about that. Stuck on the back foot, and this is a length ball moving away, takes the splice and flies up. Just short
sloppy work by Bairstow at deep square leg. Slips in the short one but not short enough and Finch controls his pull shot through square. Bairstow makes a mess of it running to his right.
back of a length, pushed to cover. Quick single taken

that is just amazing fast bowling Short leg was put in place so the batsman was expecting a short one, but Archer is so quick and so accurate that he manages to get a wicket with a short ball anyway. Banged in back of a length and hisses up like a cobra towards Stoinis who is all in a tangle against that. Fends awkwardly and it takes the shoulder of the bat to loop up for an easy catch behind him. Archer's bowling with serious fire
oooh this is some serious wheels by Archer. Short ball in the channel and what a ball to get first up. He has to hurriedly drop his wrists and arch his back to let this go through.
back of a length outside off, pushed tentatively towards point
length on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
length ball coming into him, blocked
back of a length, Finch was caught in two minds there and ended up a mite squared up, the edge plops down in front of him
fuller on off, driven to cover

another edge doesn't carry. drops well short of point. Finch is surprised by that one, bounces more off a length than he expected and takes the shoulder of the bat. He wasn't going hard at it though so it doesn't travel far
length outside off, chopped towards point
shot He's not stuck on the back foot due to Archer's threat and pace. Sees a short and wide one outside off and latches on, cuts it beautifully through point
fuller on off this time, 91 mph, and he gets his bat down in time to defend
another good bouncer, but dealt with well too. Rises up from back of a length outside off and he manages to get bat on top of it to pat it down towards point. They take a quick single too

fuller on off, Finch is hanging back but manages to stay well balanced in pushing this with soft hands towards mid-off. Goes for a quick single. Billings the fielder swooping in misses the stumps at the striker's end. Might have been curtains for Marnus. Second run-out missed by England, first one was against Finch earlier
another short ball outside off but Marnus dealing with those well, brings his bat down late to chop it to third man
fuller on the pads, turned to backward square leg
back of a length, outside off, pace off the ball, mistimes his cut as the ball trickles towards mid-off
length ball on the pads, tucked to midwicket
length on the stumps, no pace on the ball. Tapped to midwicket
fuller outside off, driven to point
back of a length outside off, width on offer but hardly any bounce and he chops it into the covers
length outside off, turning away, stroked through cover
bang. Tossed up full and wide and Finch goes down on one knee to slog-sweep it straight over the bowler's head and all the way
gets the line closer to off that time, still quite full, driven to long-off
tossed up very full outside off, driven fluently but straight to cover
googly, dragged short but don't think he read it out the hand. Had enough time to adjust and pat this through midwicket with a horizontal bat
tossed up on off, steered to point
length on the stumps, uses his wrists to work this through square leg
length on off, punched gently to cover
fuller on the pads, clipped away but straight to short midwicket
tight line on off, good length, steered to point. Still no single for Finch
straying on the legside and he gets inside the line to tuck through midwicket
length outside off, he goes back and flicks to fine leg
good length outside off, left alone
too full and room outside off, he gets down low and slaps it through cover
length, pitching on middle and spinning across, he goes right back and swipes it to long-on
straying a bit on leg and is picked off through square
under-edge goes for four. Went down for a slog-sweep, gets it under the bat and it races off to the fine-leg boundary. Uh-oh, it's a no-ball because four were not inside the circle.
down the track and swipes across the line to long-off
good ball to finish, turns sharply across him from a length on leg, defended
fuller on off, defended towards mid-off
length ball nipping back, stays in his crease and punches back to the bowler
yorker on middle stump, goes deep and drives to mid-off
dies on Buttler as it goes past off stump. Back of a length, cross-seam ball, he tries to cut it but it goes under his bat
fuller on middle and leg, patted to short midwicket
fuller, driven to mid-off
leg-break on off, he goes back and uses wrists to whip through square leg
fuller outside off, driven powerfully. Short cover gets a hand to it but can't stop it
length on off, goes back and uses wrists again to work through square
too full, too much air given, and Finch plonks his front foot down and gets underneath the ball to loft his on-drive powerfully, bounces a bit in front of the ropes
driven through cover
drags it a bit short, quicker one, clipped off his pads to deep square leg
length outside off, bit of nibble in off the seam, and Labuschagne gloves it down towards third man. Shaped to cut, but cramped for room
length on fourth stump, checked drive to short extra cover
comes down the pitch and struck on the pad as he looks to work to leg, Curran belts out an appeal but no dice. And no review. He was a long way down, and it might have hit outside the line?
clipped out to square leg for one more
length outside off, Labuschagne climbs into a back-foot punch through the covers for four! Too much width, and Marnus nails the compact drive to the rope
slower ball outside off, clipped in front of square on the leg side to retain the strike
nagging line and length, pushed across the right-hander, who defends back to the bowler from off stump
bustling medium pace from tight to the stumps, and Labuschagne clips out to square leg for one
length ball nibbling away from the off stump. Finch nudges into the covers

back of a length, Finch latches onto the short ball and nails him in front of square for four! Too short, and not enough pace to trouble Finch, who pulls hard and sends it straight through Root at short midwicket. Fielder could have done better, I reckon
nudged defensively back towards the bowler, slightly short of a length
tight to the stumps, and Curran is very straight in line. Finch defends
banged in on a length, Labuschagne rides the bounce and punches to cover on the edge of the ring
length on fourth stump, defended back down the track
slightly overpitched, and Marnus tucks off the pads out to Bairstow at deep square
length on fourth stump, Finch plays tip-and-run, sneaking a single towards cover
length ball, tucked off the pads out to deep square
cutter on the pads, clipped down to fine leg where Rashid dives to his right to cut off the boundary
beaten outside off! Wide on the crease, looked like a cross-seamer from Curran and it moved away from Labuschagne's defensive prod
too much width, and Labuschagne slaps this out to the man sweeping at deep cover
banged in, back of a length, and Finch jumps onto the back foot to defend. 83mph/134kph

very wide on the crease, Finch drops into the off side and sets off for a sharp single. Roy get round to his right from backward point, but his throw is wide of the stumps at the bowler's end, and even a direct hit might not have got him
slightly fuller on off stump, clipped out to deep midwicket for one
cutter on a length, Finch nudges into the leg side, jumping onto the back foot
lebgreak, nudged defensively towards midwicket
length ball pushed towards mid-off. Rashid gets down like a cat off his own bowling
googly, whipped off the pads down to Woakes at fine leg
pie down the leg side which takes everyone by surprise! Finch gets in position to sweep, slightly belatedly, and bottom-edges past Buttler's left boot for four. Brings up his 50
legbreak, cut away towards deep cover
legbreak, tossed up full and straight. Labuschagne presses out into the leg side; 'waiting...... no!' is the call

banged in on a length, Finch nudges out to cover and thinks about a single, but then barks 'no, no, no!' as Morgan fields. He hurls at the stumps at the bowler's end, by which time Labuschagne has just about made his ground
steered out through cover-point to Bairstow on the boundary
length on off stump, tickled to short midwicket
wide on the crease, Labuschagne punches out to cover from a length
slightly back of a length, and enough width for Finch to guide down to third man with an open face

length ball on fourth stump, clipped into the leg side. Root fields at short midwicket to prevent the single, and fortunately for him there's a man at mid-off to back up a wayward through to the bowler's end
sharp legbreak, punched out to deep cover off the back foot
sharply-spun legbreak, which turns past the bat as Labuschagne lunges forward. Brings his pace down, and rips it past the edge
steered out to backward point on the back foot
legbreak, whipped to backward square from outside off and they scamper back for the second, despite Bairstow getting round quickly and firing in a throw. Even a direct hit wouldn't have been enough
legbreak on the stumps, clipped out to square leg again but Bairstow gets there in time to stop the second, this time
tucked off the hip for a jogged single to short fine leg
length ball from wide on the crease, nudged out to mid-off. Stifled appeal from Curran, as Finch defended with bat and pad together
cross-seamer in at the pads, Finch can't tuck it away and is struck high on the thigh pad
slightly back of a length outside off, Finch gets a thick edge looking to punch through point and it flies down towards third man
slower ball on the stumps, clipped out to long leg for a quick two
pace-on, slightly full of a length, and Labuschagne drops into the covers, where Morgan races in to prevent a single
loopy bouncer outside the off stump at 84mph/135kph. Labuschagne lets it go, and it's called wide
cutter on a length, dabbed towards point for a scampered single to retain strike
floaty legbreak, thumped out to deep cover
flatter legbreak, cut out to deep point for one
legbreak, tucked off the pads to short midwicket for a very quick single, as Morgan throws underarm at the stumps from short midwicket but misses at the bowler's end
legbreak, pushed out to cover but straight to the fielder

tossed up, full and straight, and Finch thumps it straight down the ground for four! Huge backlift and nailed through Rashid's hands, racing away from Billings at long-off to his right. Arguably a half-chance for the bowler, but it would have been one of the best catches of all time!
tosses up a sharply-spun legbreak, which turns sharply away from the bat as Finch looks to heave another boundary over long-on
cross-seamer which nips away from Labuschagne as he looks to work to leg. He yelps in pain as he is struck on the back thigh pad, and Archer lets out a wry smile
length ball on fourth stump at 85mph/137kph, which Finch bravely leaves alone. It zips just past the top of off, vindicating his decision
banged in, slightly full of a length at 86mph/138kph. Finch inside-edges into the leg side, looking to play a checked drive
full and straight, tucked off the pads behind square for a couple as Billings gives chase.
yorker on off stump at 87mph/141kph, dug out towards mid-on. Finch is stung by some vibrations as that thuds into the toe
fullish on fourth stump, Finch pushes back towards Archer's left hand
length on fifth stump, keeps a little low as Labuschagne jams the bat down to defend
length ball on sixth stump, guided down to third man with an open face
length ball on fifth stump, angling in and nipping away to beat Finch's outside edge, as he prods awkwardly at this away from his body
length ball on the stumps, clipped to wide mid-on

length on fourth stump, tip-and-run into the off side for a single that is never there, but Roy's throw is wide! Never a single, but Roy's throw to the keeper's end was wayward from backward point, and they steal a second run as Bairstow falls over while backing up. Chaos!
nudged defensively into the leg side
length ball on fourth stump, 88mph/141kph, and Labuschagne jams the bat down to defend with a yelp of 'no run!'
slower ball on a length, steered to backward point for a sharp single. Looked like a legcutter, I think
short ball in at the ribs, 89mph/143kph, and Finch wears one as he is late on the pull. Smashed him between the left pectoral and the biceps, and Finch swears in pain
clipped into the leg side with soft hands, and Labuschagne calls 'two, two, two!' They hurry through, and make it back for the second
length on sixth stump, Finch jumps onto the back foot to punch it straight to short cover
slightly back of a length, and Finch swats it down to long leg to retain the strike
beauty on a length in the channel which beats Finch! Fifth stump, on a length, and Finch dangles his bat at it optimistically
in the slot on the stumps, pushed uppishly towards mid-off on the bounce
slightly full of a length on fourth stump, nudged into the covers for a quick single
Labuschagne shimmies over to the off side and takes a step down the pitch. Woakes drags his length back, but it sits up nicely for him and he pulls sweetly through backward square for four!
nudged out to square leg for one, which brings up the 100-run stand from only 128 balls. These two have put Australia in control
wide on the crease, bold leave from Finch as this keeps slightly low and nearly brushes his off stump! Nearly made to look very silly
short outside off at 87mph/141kph. Labuschagne shapes to leave, but dangles the bat in the way of the ball to steer it down to third man for one. Not sure he knew much about where that was going
tight to the stumps, Archer hits a length at 88mph/141kph, and Finch pushes effortlessly to deep cover
slower ball, full on the stumps, and dug out towards mid-on. Might have been the knuckleball, dipped in late
back of a length, steered through gully and down to third man for a sharp two. Rashid should probably have done better running in from the boundary, but great running from Australia yet again
length in the channel at 89mph/144kph, Labuschagne is late on it, and steers an awkward upper-cut over gully as he looks to withdraw the bat. Gets lucky, and it loops up to Rashid on the bounce
full and straight, tickled down to fine leg to keep the strike
straight length ball, Finch defends back down the pitch, jumping onto the back foot
banged in on a length, cut out to point on the bounce where Roy fields
length on off stump, nudged to short extra cover
length outside off, pressed out to cover and they scamper through for another tight single

trapped on the pad, Woakes lets out a desperate appeal but Gough says no. Morgan reviews immediately. This struck both pads as he looked to work a length ball to leg, but crucially hit the front one first. No bat, Ultra-Edge confirms. Hits him in line, and would have smashed into middle two-thirds of the way up! Marnus has to trudge off, and Woakes has the breakthrough
length outside off, pressed out into the covers
back of a length at 87mph/140kph, Marsh rides the bounce to guide into the covers
banged in on a length at 87mph/140kph, and steered towards cover-point
back of a length, Marsh rides the bounce and pushes into the covers
slower ball on a length, steered straight to point with an open face

gottim! Archer gets the breakthrough, Marsh chops onto his stumps! Slightly back of a length, didn't get up much at all off the surface as Marsh jammed the bat down on it, and only managed to inside-edge into the timber. England are jubilant - if they get Finch soon, it's game on!
short ball in at the hip, Carey prods awkwardly at it and thinks about one but is sent back by Finch
length ball nipping in, defended from the crease
fuller outside off, goes to drive it, toe-ends it to short cover

cleaned him up! three wickets in less than two overs and the captain's gone now. This was a length ball closer to off stump and held its line after pitching. Finch was playing inside the line and it clatters stumps.
ooh went a long way across, but got his bat in front of his pad and nudged it to midwicket
length on off, keeps a bit low, jams his bat down
comes on the front foot and opens the face to steer to third man
short fast, and into his rib cage. Maxwell wasn't even looking at it just turned around into a half-hearted pull. The ball thuds into bat. It was ball hitting bat, not bat hitting ball. 91 mph
length on off, defended on the front foot
slower one, at just 77 mph, nipping into him. Just about defended by Maxwell
tailing into him at 89 mph, flicks the pad and goes to short fine leg. Lots of leg-byes off Archer today
full, almost yorker length but solid in defence is Carey
and Archer ends a fantastic day with the ball with a sharply jagging in delivery that hits Carey on the thigh pad, defeating his back foot defence. Half an appeal but that was too high.

knocked him over! Australia might have been mentally breathing a sigh of relief at no more Archer. If so, they forgot there's still Woakes. Very similar to how Finch got out, Maxwell just playing down the wrong line totally and loses his stumps
full and angling into him, straightens a bit, Cummins forward defence is more hopeful than convincing, squirts off the edge to third man
pushed into the offside on the front foot
full and on off, defended to cover
edge doesn't carry to slip. Pushing down the wrong line again, the ball also straightened off a length on middle. But soft hands so the ball bounces well before reaching Root at slip
goes for the yorker, but ends up as a low full toss on the stumps, turned away to square leg
googly that he didn't read, was coming forward to defend, takes the inside edge and rolls backward of square
too full, and he comes on the front foot to flick this to wide long-on
tossed up, ends as a full toss, but Cummins can't put it away. Patted tamely to mid-on
big-spinning leg-break and Cummins was targetting cow corner with a big slog-sweep. Defeated completely
plays it more carefully this time, coming forward to a tossed up delivery and gently steering towards point
nicely done, saw the ball full and swept it fine. The man at fine leg is square so has to run to his left to field
back of a length on leg stump, takes the pads to roll towards leg gully
length into him to tuck him up, patted towards short midwicket
hisses past the outside edge as Carey is caught on the crease and poking at it. Keeps bat close to body though
back of a length angling in on off, tapped towards mid-on
rapped on the pads but that's going down. Angling into him, and he can't connect with the flick off his pads
length ball outside off, and pushed to mid-off
tossed up outside off, gets him to stretch forward and pat it in defence
teasing loop, dips and grips to turn past the hopeful forward defensive prod
boom. Rashid goes too full and Cummins gets a free swing of his arms to loft this over long-on. Way over.
length outside off, defended
big spin again, pitched short of a length and spun across him, he stayed in his crease and followed the ball with his hands to defend
beaten again, big stride out to defend but the ball spins past the bat
length outside off, defended to cover on the front foot
length outside off, tapped through cover
squirted away through backward point
length outside off, opens the face to run it down to third man
bounces a bit more than Cummins expects it to and he gets it high on the bat as it pops up. No short leg though and it lands there
length outside off, punched to mid-off
back of a length outside off, cuts it to deep point. Good work by the fielder to run to his left and keep them to one run

clatter Went around the wicket and Cummins was looking to hit his way out of the building pressure, has a big swipe across the line. Gets a bottom edge that ensures the ball clatters into the stumps. Not enough room for the pull shot, but then, Cummins is not a top order batsman

got him first ball! This is all unravelling rather quickly for Australia. Length ball outside off, on a sixth or seventh stump line in fact, Starc has a waft at it, no foot movement to speak of, and gets a healthy edge that Buttler tumbles to his left and grabs.
full on the stumps and Zampa offers the full face of the bat to defend and keep out the hat-trick ball
fuller into him, defended to mid-off
full and outside off again, defended into the offside again
length ball angling into him, tries to play it with the angle, the ball trickles towards short fine leg
length outside off, pushes it back to the bowler's left
angling into him straighter and he manages to nurdle it to fine leg. Tom Curran holds his head in his hands, he didn't want to give away that single. Wanted Zampa on strike
fuller on the leg stump, flicked off his toes through midwicket
back of a length outside off, no pace or bounce to work with, his push finds the toe-end of the bat hitting ball and it not travelling very far
fuller on off, pushed firmly to mid-off

short and wide outside off, cuts it nicely through backward point. Good effort in the deep by Tom Currant to run around and cut off the boundary but the attempted relay through goes awry as he lobs it out of Morgan's reach. That allows the batsmen to take a third
hit on a hard length from wide of the crease around the wicket and straightening a touch, solid defence offered
full on off, driven on the front foot, but short cover intercepts
length ball nibbling in the off stump area, punches into cover
zips in on off stump again, and he offers a straight bat in defence
nice change-up, bouncer to end the over that passes over off stump, Zampa is not expecting that, tries to upper cut it but is too late on it
fuller on off, punched to point
angling into him a bit fuller, clipped to mid-on
swing and a miss. back of a length on the off stump and angling in, he clears his front leg to swipe across the line. Doesn't connect. The ball goes over the stumps
back of a length again, this time he goes back in his crease and punches it straight, gets it past the bowler
fuller and a bit too straight, clipped to mid-on's right
was backing away but Tom saw that and followed him, ends up inside-edging a drive towards square leg
length on off, tight line, bunted to mid-on
stepping away to make room again, but Same also follows him and he's gone so far down leg that the ball beats his outside edge while going past leg-stump line
and he changes up from bowling it short and into him to bowling a yorker on the fifth stump. Zampa tries to get low and get bat on it but can't. Good, smart bowling
length ball outside off, another big swipe across the line, takes the bottom edge off the end of the bat and bounces down

pops up straight in the air and Archer moves to his right at mid-off and holds it with both hands above his head. That's the end of Zampa. Was moving away again and aiming to go down the ground, too early into the shot and it just spoons up.
inside edge onto pad off his attempted punch, but he ball goes slowly into the covers and they take a single
backs away but Curran follows him and he can only mis-time the pull to wide long-on. Doesn't get a second
length ball angling into him on the pads, comfortably tucked through square leg for a single
saw him backing away and he bowls a slower ball full and wide of off. Carey ends up trying to reach for it and can't connect
punchy drive but straight to extra cover. This was full and on middle, he made some room and connected well, but not in the gap
back of a length, swats a pull to wide long-on, again not well timed
oh he's going to take the single and keep strike. Fuller on the pads, glanced to fine leg
floats up a fuller ball on the stumps, flicked to short midwicket

slips in the short ball, Hazlewood tries o paddle-pull it and the ball misses bat but hits his body and drops at his feet. Sam rushes across in his follow through and kicks the ball onto the stumps but Carey was quick off the blocks and makes his ground
just can't get them away. This one is dug into a length and doesn't come on to the bat as Carey shapes to slap it away. Gets it through cover but no further
length on off, patted to long-on
tries to drive, but no timing, and straight back down the pitch
keeps the strike for the next over with a single through square leg
googly, pulled across the line out to deep backward square
googly again, Hazlewood keeps his eye on it and pulls unconvincingly for one through midwicket
brings out the reverse, jumping across towards the leg side, and laps it to Tom Curran at third man who put it down! Leaping at full stretch, gets a fingertip on it, and parries it down to third man
fired into the pitch, heaved out to long-on for one more
flat legbreak, clipped off the hip for one more to square leg

brings out the slog-sweep to a full ball, flat on off stump, and finally gets his first boundary! Eventually gets one out the middle, and it races away in front of square to beat Billings diving to his right at deep midwicket
bustling medium pace, tight to the stumps, and Hazlewood clips into the leg side from the top of off to get off strike
banged in on a length, punched out towards wide extra cover and they pinch a single
width outside the off stump, cut away in front of square to get Carey back on strike
back of a length, Carey gets it up over mid-off for four! Slightly too short from Curran, banged into the pitch, and Carey swung hard, cross-batted, to send it over the rope after a couple of bounces
bustling line and length, Carey heaves it down the ground with a grunt, but no timing. It trickles down towards long-on, and they'll pinch a second run
back of a length, tucked out to square leg to keep the strike
flat and fullish, goes for the slog-sweep, but only gets the bottom edge to short fine leg.
quick single taken. Tossed up googly that Hazlewood didn't read, was trying to tickle it fine, goes into the offside
googly and he misses it! Clearing his front leg to sweep that into oblivion, can't get bat on it with the google floated up on off and turning away

stumped by a mile! and England have kept the series alive. The slog sweep weren't working for Carey so he shimmies down the track. Rashid bowls a third successive googly - Carey hasn't been reading them anyway - and this is out of his reach, spinning further away. Fast hands by Buttler to whip the bails off and seal the win.
